meanings.definition: Of the same age or date; contemporary.
meanings.sent1: The twins were coeval, born on the same day.
meanings.sent2: The two buildings were coeval, constructed in the same year.
meanings.sent3: It was funny how their interests were coeval, always liking the same things.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a coeval bond, growing stronger with time.
meanings.sent5: The coeval trees in the forest stood tall together, witnessing history.

meanings.definition: A person or thing of the same age or date.
meanings.sent1: She found a coeval in her new class, someone born in the same year.
meanings.sent2: The two cars parked side by side were coevals, both from the 1960s.
meanings.sent3: The coevals in the group shared a special connection, understanding each other well.
meanings.sent4: The old watch and the antique clock were coevals, ticking away the years together.
meanings.sent5: The coevals in the museum display told a story of the past, standing as equals in time.
